p: ESS data are publicly available and downloadable at the ESS website. The collection of their self-reported data is based on informed consent and subscribes to the Declaration of Professional Ethics of the International Statistical Institute. All ESS surveys have gone through ethical review by the ESS European Research Infrastructure Consortium Research Ethics Board [ 29]. Our analyses focused on creating country-level information, and no observations at the individual level were used. Other used data were also publicly available. All data and code are available via Open Science Framework [ 30].
